text: Hi Corey long time no see. I find Mech very perplexing. I think you need to put a little more effort into EBNF grammar, and explain what the notation #ball = [|x y vx vy| xx xx vx vy] means. When one encounters a new language, you fall back to the syntax one is most familiar with like Java or in my case C or Modula-2. The brackets means subscript, and the vertical bar is logical OR in C. You are defining some ball entity which does something. Anyway i tried the program and it drew 5 dots, but i had no idea why.

text: Congrats. I saw talk recently of running Pharo on BeagleBone Black. If this is achievable, would your Toolkit run on that platform also?

elements.text: Congrats. I saw talk recently of running Pharo on BeagleBone Black. If this is achievable, would your Toolkit run on that platform also?

text: Also Glamorous is a great name :sparkles:

elements.text: Also Glamorous is a great name

text: Pharo is a mature language and a strong runtime (one of the fastest VM in the dynamic language world). The Pharo VM uses only one CPU, so the way you deal with distribution is to have one worker image per CPU, not unlike JS, Python or Ruby.

elements.text: Pharo is a mature language and a strong runtime (one of the fastest VM in the dynamic language world). The Pharo VM uses only one CPU, so the way you deal with distribution is to have one worker image per CPU, not unlike JS, Python or Ruby.

text:
<@UEGFXUK3M> Glamorous Toolkit is a graphical and tooling environment. A Pharo system is made of a VM and image. An image offers the language and runtime, and the environment. Glamorous Toolkit offers an alternative environment, which is half of the image, and arguably, what makes a Smalltalk system special.

In fact, the Pharo distribution already ships the first generation of the Glamorous Toolkit since four years. The new generation that you see at <http://gtoolkit.com|gtoolkit.com> is based on a complete new implementation on top of a new graphical stack that has some unique properties and includes a highly flexible and dynamic text editor.

elements.text:
Glamorous Toolkit is a graphical and tooling environment. A Pharo system is made of a VM and image. An image offers the language and runtime, and the environment. Glamorous Toolkit offers an alternative environment, which is half of the image, and arguably, what makes a Smalltalk system special.

In fact, the Pharo distribution already ships the first generation of the Glamorous Toolkit since four years. The new generation that you see at
is based on a complete new implementation on top of a new graphical stack that has some unique properties and includes a highly flexible and dynamic text editor.
